div.div:
(0) Run docker-compose first.
(1) Read variables from .env. iPXE server will find an IP of next-server when read it. docker-compose will boot iPXE server and image server after read it.
(2) When a client has started, it will broadcast DHCP. iPXE server returns IP of client, IP of gateway etc and a URL of iPXE firmware if the client is PXE (not iPXE).
(3) A client obtain a firmware of iPXE with TFTP. The firmware might be located in another server.
(4) After the client rebooted as iPXE client, iPXE client will broadcast DHCP. iPXE server returns IP of client, IP of gateway etc and a URL of OS images.
(5) Obtain iPXE script with HTTP or tftp etc. Image server returns an iPXE script and client will enter an iPXE boot menu.
(6) iPXE client requests an OS image that the user has choosen on iPXE boot menu. The image server returns an image. A client will boot by using the image.
